At the age of 80+This is my first tweet. Here are my own views on fishing most of the Yorkshire rivers over the past 50 years. In the 50s & 60s the river Polution was visible. @ChrisMountainNP @EnvAgency @thameswater @FriendsRivCrane After a dry spell the heavy rain will have flushed dirt into/out the surface(?) drain. But misconections could also be playing a role. We need to treat these discharges somehow.

@CleanIlkley @YorkshireWater @EnvAgencyYNE @_RobbieMoore A wetter climate = exceptional circumstances being the norm, goal posts just moved. Sewage should not enter a river at all. But what do you expect when we don't own the water company's. Just another dilemna for gov to brush under the carpet.

urls.title: Calder Valley Radio
urls.description: Your Community station for the Calder Valley, West Yorkshire. We are the local Radio Station keeping you up to date with Local News, Gigs, up and coming Talent, along with great Local Presenters. Based in Mytholmroyd, we are interested in businesses and charity organisations to get involved and help us promote the Calder Valley.

text: With John Cave from @YISF__INNS & Sally Kelling from @EnvAgencyYNE on @CValleyRadio talking all things Invasive species and Climate Change. Got to pick the playlist too üò± - first 2 tunes - Freefalling To@ Petty and Dance by ESG. Listen in live at https://t.co/3FViHuMynT üíö
